title: Access to tomcat-manager with default creds
content:
Summary:
Hi jetblue Security Team.
I Found that this domain █████████ using Apache Tomcat/6.0.35 , And i was able to login to https://██████████/manager/html With default credentials tomcat:tomcat
See the following Screenshots:-
██████████
███
Steps To Reproduce:
Go To https://███████/manager/html
Login with default creds tomcat:tomcat
Supporting Material/References:
https://book.hacktricks.xyz/pentesting/pentesting-web/tomcat
Impact
Improper Authentication
Default Credentials lead to access admin manager.
Fix:-
Change default creds.
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves accessing the Apache Tomcat manager interface using default credentials (tomcat:tomcat), which allows unauthorized administrative access to the server.
reason: The attack is straightforward, involving only the use of default credentials without any need for complex interactions or state manipulations. Default credentials are well-documented and commonly known in security contexts.

authnz_metadata.reasoning: The vulnerability involves access via default credentials (tomcat:tomcat) to an admin interface. The methodology includes testing AuthN/AuthZ bypass by checking access with unauthenticated or non-privileged sessions. Since this is a direct authentication bypass using well-known default credentials (a classic AuthN flaw), it aligns with the 'AuthN/AuthZ Bypass' detection method (step d: execute actions with unauthenticated sessions). The system would detect this by attempting common default credentials during AuthN checks.
